page.title: 01PUDDLETOWN AREA,DORSET
page.content: { {Puddletown, Dorset}is set in a shallow valley of the River Piddle (or Trent) 5 miles east of the county town{Dorchester.}It is surrounded on three sides by undulating farmland and by Puddletown Forest to the west. A village with an ancient history, Puddletown was mentioned in the original{Domesday Book.}In that time it has slowly grown into a sizeable village of over 1,000 people.The buildings in the area reflect these changes ranging from the 16th century to modern developments. The area is a thriving rural community with {agriculture}being the obvious main influence.Apart from farming the other main forms of employment are concerned with providing services for local people such as shops and garages.
